title: Spirals, Tic-Tac-Toe Partition, and Deep Diagonal Maps
abstract:
The deep diagonal map $T_k$ acts on planar polygons by connecting the $k$-th
diagonals and intersecting them successively. The map $T_2$ is the pentagram
map and $T_k$ is a generalization. We study the action of $T_k$ on two special
subsets of the so-called twisted polygons, which we name \textit{$k$-spirals of
type $\alpha$ and $\beta$}. Both types of $k$-spirals are twisted $n$-gons that
resemble the shape of inward spirals on the affine patch under suitable
projective normalization. We show that for $k \geq 3$, $T_{k}$ preserves both
types of $k$-spirals. In particular, we show that the two types of $3$-spirals
have precompact forward and backward $T_3$ orbits, and these special orbits in
the moduli space are partitioned into squares of a $3 \times 3$ tic-tac-toe
grid. This establishes the action of $T_k$ on $k$-spirals as a nice geometric
generalization of $T_2$ on convex polygons.
